TopicTitle: [1.0.5] Adjustable Landing Gear v1.2.0 (mass/cost scaling, tech nodes, drag) - May 30

Articles.Content: Thanks for the help!

My wheels are having problems. The symmetry isn't working right, the single wheel gear isn't mirrored, its doubled, so that the wheel is on the same side of both gears. Also, I have no "auto align" button. I got the firespitter.dll but I don't know if I put it in the right place. I just dropped it in gamedata. Help please
Wishing a 1.0 update soon!

Looking forward to seeing this mod continue. Hope... We might get some larger gear as well.

any chance the 1.0 stock gear can be integrated into this mod, would love to be able to play around with the wheel angles for the big plane gear

any chance the 1.0 stock gear can be integrated into this mod, would love to be able to play around with the wheel angles for the big plane gear

If you look closely at the way the stock gear are built and the way the way the adjustable gear move, you'll see that this isn't possible. The stock gear have an arm attaching the lower and upper parts, which must be able to separate in order to be adjustable.

Having played about with this for a little while in 1.0, I was pleasantly surprised to find out it works okay(ish) - main thing I've spotted so far is a massive framerate drop on opening the tweakable menu - aside from that, they seem to behave themselves pretty well.

nuFAR determines the voxel profile of an aircraft to determine drag. For some reason, adjustable landing gears always show up with a bulky cube, bringing huge amount of drag in nuFAR. Stock gears are fine.

nuFAR determines the voxel profile of an aircraft to determine drag. For some reason, adjustable landing gears always show up with a bulky cube, bringing huge amount of drag in nuFAR. Stock gears are fine.

Landing gear have an invisible collider to determine it's bounds so the vessel spawner knows how high off the runway to place it. The collider is disabled when spawned, but perhaps nuFAR doesn't check to see if a collider is enabled or disabled when including it in the voxel profile. Solution on my end would be to completely destroy the bounds collider on spawn - but perhaps this should be reported to ferram.

Do you think that you can either update this to 1.0 or maybe answer why the gear have no collision for me i'll load up the ship but the gear spin down and they fall through the ground they also do not have the ability to retract is there anything you may know of that could be doing this or maybe some way to fix this

Thanks for the pointer. I tried all the changes he did that I didn't already, and I'm still having the issue.

Stranger yet, it only happens when the sliders are at certain values. It's perfectly fine when leg height is 0.52, but lags when it's 0.54 for some reason.

Anyway, I'm going to let it slide and move on so I can just release it sooner. It's not game breaking.. just irritating.
